entry.title: Add density metric for WebP still images
entry.content:
This CL is the WebP version of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4626160.



The original Blink.DecodedImage.WebPDensity.KiBWeighted histogram was

added by Alex Deymo in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3257406, and

removed by Moritz Firsching in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4548468 after

it expired.



In bringing back the histogram, I made the following changes:

1. Add "2" to the histogram name so we don't mix the data with the old

Blink.DecodedImage.WebPDensity.KiBWeighted data.

2. It is recorded only for still images, not for animated images.

Note: We probably should also exclude images with alpha from this

histogram.



Bug: 1456182

Change-Id: I2ce1dc7785d394b80690c37c63cb1304617e5747

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4653170

Reviewed-by: Philip Rogers

Commit-Queue: Takashi Toyoshima

Reviewed-by: Takashi Toyoshima

Auto-Submit: Wan-Teh Chang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1163957}

entry.title: Introduce two NetworkContext methods for managing shared dictionaries
entry.content:
This CL introduces two methods in `NetworkContext` for managing shared

dictionaries:

* `GetSharedDictionaryUsageInfo()`: This method returns information

about the stored shared dictionary usage.

* `ClearSharedDictionaryCacheForIsolationKey()`: This method clears

dictionaries which are registered for the specified isolation key.



These methods will be used to manage shared dictionaries from

`chrome://settings/content/all` and the Page Specific Site Data Dialog

(crbug.com/1413922#c59).

entry.title: Roll src/net/third_party/quiche/src/ 87fe08172..12dae956d (4 commits)
entry.content:
https://quiche.googlesource.com/quiche.git/+log/87fe081729f9..12dae956d972



$ git log 87fe08172..12dae956d --date=short --no-merges --format='%ad %ae %s'

2023-06-28 danzh Split QUIC_CODE_COUNT(gquic_padded_ping_received) into 2 to distinguish connection liveness testing and probing.

2023-06-28 danzh Make QUIC toy client to log TTFB and TTLB to std::out for each request by counting response header received time and response completion time in QuicSpdyClientStream.

2023-06-28 vasilvv Log whenever SetSendAlgorithm() is called.

2023-06-28 bnc Add HttpValidationPolicy::disallow_double_quote_in_header_name.

entry.title: Prerender UKM: Lifecycle check when AudioContextManager records UKMs
entry.content:
AudioContext creation is permitted even during the prerendering, but the

context should not start running even if the autoplay is permitted by

the policy. This restriction allows us to have a lifecycle CHECK in the

AudioContextManagerImpl as the manager is constructed when the context

starts running. This condition check is needed to record UKMs as the

data collection policy disallows collecting it while prerendering.

GetPageUkmSourceId() returns meaningless ID for such cases now, but it

would cause CHECK failure in the near future.



Bug: 1245014

entry.title: Prerender UKM: PrefetchNetworkContext ensures lifecycle state
entry.content:
PrefetchNetworkContext calls GetPageUkmSourceId to pass it on

URLLoaderFactory creation. But the obtained ID is valid only when the

page is not in the prerendering state.

This condition is ensured as the prerendering page doesn't trigger any

prefetch request. This patch adds lifecycle CHECK to verify it.

have a lifecycle check before calling GetUkmSourceId().

prerendering page doesn't make any prefetch request and

entry.title: [win] Use top-level widget for fullscreen notification
entry.content:
On Windows, a topmost child window will be placed behind other topmost

windows when its parent gains focus. This is undesired for the

fullscreen notification, a security-related window, which was being

occluded by the PiP window under certain circumstances.



Fix this by showing fullscreen notification in a top-level widget.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Incorporate about page into main page container
entry.content:
Historically, the About page was handled specially: When the About page

is visible, all other pages are hidden. When other pages are visible,

the about page is hidden. This was implemented with unnecessarily

complex code, including using MainPageMixin for the About page.



This CL refactors the About page to be included in the main set of pages

like all other pages are. The mutually exclusive nature of the page

visibility is maintained.



Screen recordings:

OsSettingsRevampWayfinding enabled: http://shortn/_TbgV3S11Zd

OsSettingsRevampWayfinding disabled: http://shortn/_IQn7tYxu5Y



search results deep link to the correct settings/elements.



Bug: b/288582432, b/282154231

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="OSSettings*"

Making CompanionSidePanelUntrustedUI a delegate broke behavior supplied

by BubbleContentsWrapperT, including keyboard shortcuts on Mac. Moves the WebContentsDelegate functionality into BubbleContentsWrapper and

adds a view for controlling companion-specific behavior.



Tested that context menu and opening URLs in new tab/window works;

keyboard shortcuts work on Mac; display capture for region search

feedback works.



The code being fixed was added in https://crrev.com/c/4621328 and

https://crrev.com/c/4630427. This was patched from https://crrev.com/c/4651953

entry.title: Adjust padding around CrOS touch selection handles.
entry.content:
Adjust padding of touch selection handles to mostly match Figma mocks

at go/next-e14s-touchtext. This padding is invisible and is used to

expand the targetable area of the touch handles to make them easier to

target.



At some point, it would probably be nice to extract the padding

constants (and other constants related to drawing the touch handles) to

ensure it is consistent between TouchHandleDrawableAura (used from web

content) and TouchSelectionControllerImpl (used from views). However,

the padding applied to TouchHandleDrawableAura is currently a bit

confusing since the TouchHandleDrawable interface is also shared with

the Android touch selection handles. For now, just add comments

clarifying some of the non-intuitive parts.



These changes are just planned for CrOS at the moment (maybe Desktop

Chrome later), keep it all behind a flag for now.



Bug: b:264823752

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Add padding when textfield hovered.
entry.content:
In ChromeRefresh we need additional border space so that the hover

state has some padding between the edge of Textfield and the text.

We will match the horizontal hover insets to that of the

vector button and take this into account when calculating the

margins for the textfield. This gives us symmetry between the

left margin of the FindBarView which is lined up with the Textfield

and the right margin of the FindBarView which is lined up with

the close button.



This CL also renames layout provider variables for more clarify.

entry.title: Use VectorIcons with ColorId for aura touch selection handles.
entry.content:
Add vector icons for aura touch selection handles and add basic support

for following the color pipeline. For now, only use these under the CrOS

touch text editing redesign flag, but add the changes to the general

aura implementation so that it is easier to update other aura platforms

as well if it is later needed.



For TouchSelectionControllerImpl (used from views), the handles follow

the usual views color pipeline. For TouchHandleDrawableAura (used from

web content), we just make the handles follow the native theme, since it

seems a bit fiddly to get it to follow the color theme of the context

window at the moment.



Figma specs: go/next-e14s-touchtext

(Opacity, padding, CrOS-specific color not to specs yet, will work on

that in followups.)



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4bxkuwc9jLKKfqX.png

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3w9qzk2uP3kGSyY.png

(i.e. similar, just slightly bigger and supports dynamic color.)

entry.title: [Test Automation] Provide description for Check[Result]()
entry.content:
Since Check() and CheckResult() key off of a dummy element, it's not

clear which Check() has failed when a test sequence with multiple checks

fails.



This allows you to specify an optional "check description" string when

adding a Check() or CheckResult() step; this will be included in the

default description of the step.



This could also be achieved by calling

Check(....).SetDescription("My additional description") but this is

wordy and it's not clear that doing this is a best practice; by making

the description a parameter of the verb itself, we prompt test-writers

to fill it out.



Change-Id: Ice44c0bd6d50f2430205b3bfc67cdef1899d38d7

entry.title: Fix hover card icon color change on system theme
entry.content:
Hover card tab alert icons were coded to match the icon color of that

in the tab strip. However, this makes the icons hard to see when there

is a mismatch in system theme and chrome theme. For example, if the

system is in light theme, but chrome uses a dark colored theme, the

icon will be white on a light gray background hover card. This CL fixes

this issue by having the hover card icon color to reflect what the

icons should icon should look like in light/dark system theme instead

of the customized chrome theme



Before fix: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/44vR9y7WfRsiT9b.png

After fix: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3Se2Kzd4mhBp3PV.png



Fixed: 1453897

entry.title: WebUI: Introduce new test mechanism, without js2gtest and test_api.js
entry.content:
- Introduce a new WebUIMochaBrowserTest C++ base class for WebUI tests,

as an alternative to the current WebUIBrowserTest base class. Hook it

up to code coverage reporting, to maintain parity with the

WebUIBrowserTest.

- Introduce a new mocha_adapter_simple.ts file, which bridges the gap

between Mocha (frontend) and Gtest (C++ backend), and does not rely

on test_api.js, chrome.send(), or any special web_ui_test.mojom Mojo

bindings, or webui_test_mojo_support.js. All of these are unnecessary

with the new mechanism.

- Update test_loader.{html/ts} to accept a new `adapter` URL parameter,

which allows specifying 'mocha_adapter_simple.js' instead of the

current 'mocha_adapter.js'.

- Add web_ui_mocha_test_browsertest.cc tests, to test the new testing

mechanism itself.



The new mechanism is significantly simpler than the current, decade

old mechanism which relies on js2gtest/test_api.js, and removes a lot

of unnecessary complexity (like JS -> C++ code generation) and

intermediate layers. Among other benefits, the new mechanism paves

the way for testing chrome-untrusted:// WebUIs, because it does not rely

on chrome.send(), or special test Mojo bindings, to signal test

completion back to the C++.



Migrations of WebUI tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest will happen

gradually in separate follow-up CLs.

entry.title: Reland "Rename blink::UrlPattern to blink::SafeUrlPattern."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 91be4bcad0a436fd0fd1ef5c8a1000c8969af137

Fixed the build failure in third_party/blink/renderer/modules/service_worker/service_worker_router_type_converter_test.cc

(Please see the difference between patch set 1 and 2.)



Original change's description:

> Rename blink::UrlPattern to blink::SafeUrlPattern.

>

> This is a follow up CL of:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4570363/comment/6ce953c7_50911e39/

>

> There is blink::URLPattern, which is used for the URLPattern API.

> https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/URLPattern/URLPattern

> It should be used within blink to realize the API.

>

> At the same time, there is blink::UrlPattern. It was renamed from

> blink::Manifest::UrlPattern in:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4422961

> The renaming happened to make URLPattern usable not only Manifest but also

> ServiceWorker Static Routing API.

> https://github.com/yoshisatoyanagisawa/service-worker-static-routing-api

>

> In both cases, blink::UrlPattern aims to bring URLPattern definition in

> the renderer process to the browser process to make the evaluation

> executed there. Therefore, its capability is a bit limited due to the

> security reason. Especially, a user-defined regex is not allowed.

>

> Considering the difference, I believe it is natural to leave blink::URLPattern,

> which might need to be the same name with the API, and changing

> blink::UrlPattern to blink::SafeUrlPattern to clarify it is

> modified for the security reason. To allow URLPattern usable in

> the browser process, user-defined regular expression has been

> dropped for SafeUrlPattern.

>

> Bug: 1371756

> Change-Id: I719366a4e021ccf8441fab5ee49ecec2f3378ff4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4617993

entry.title: Use WeakPtrs with AudioDeviceListenerWin
entry.content:
There is a potential race condition on shutdown if there is a device

change as AudioManagerWin is destroyed.



This CL fixes the issue by using WeakPtrs. The use of WeakPtrs is nuanced and intentional here, to accommodate for different threading

situations:

- When the audio service is run out of process, there is no issue,

as there is only one thread, and WeakPtrs can be used without

afterthought.

- When the audio service is run in process, there is a main thread on

which the AudioManagerWin is created & destroyed, and the Audio thread

on which the AudioManagerWin operates. We make sure to allocate and invalidate WeakPtrs on the audio thread, before the WeakPtrFactory

is destroyed on the main thread, to avoid threading issues.



crbug.com/1458623 will aim to remove kAudioServiceOutOfProcess and

simplify this by only running audio out of process.

entry.title: Run ParseFileSystemSources() when clipboard changes
entry.content:
http://go/cros-filesapp-copy-paste-files-ash



Monitor clipboard changes and when we detect that FilesApp has written a

list of FileSystemURLs as 'fs/sources', we parse those to Files and add

them to the clipboard.



This was previously only done in exo which would make files available to

lacros (and other exo clients), but not to ash browser. This change

makes it possible to copy-paste (Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V) from FilesApp into

apps such as gmail in ash-chrome.



The existing code and test for ParseFileSystemSources() is moved

from ChromeDataExchangeDelegate into file_manager/path_util where it

can still be accessed by ChromeDataExchangeDelegate for drag-drop,

but also accessed by VolumeManager which will observe clipboard

changes.

entry.title: [exo] Fix AuraOutputManager::Get() crash
entry.content:
The implementation of AuraOutputManager::Get() iterates over the

resources associated with a client to find the associated instance.



This can result in a crash if this happens after the lacros client

has disconnected from the server. When this occurs wl_client_destroy

is called and begins to destroy / free resources [1].



The destruction of resources is done in the order by which the client

bound to the server objects (and shouldn't be relied on). The

data structures that hold these now freed resources are not

immediately updated, and thus point to freed memory.



The crash occurs because the destruction of resources can invoke

destructors on associated user data - which may result in calls to

AuraOutputManager::Get(). This then attempts to iterate over

resources that have now been freed and Chrome crashes.



Specifically (as it relates to the bug), if a surface resource was

destroyed/freed before an output resource, the surface's destructor

may attempt to update output/display state. This output/display

update would attempt to use AuraOutputManager to send updated data

to the client, causing a crash when iterating over freed memory.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/wayland/src/src/wayland-server.c;l=892;drc=66a24337ec401573418985515275f753c72272d6



Bug: 1433187, 1459067

Change-Id: I13a4ddd6d61fae9581791e92d2cd5131ad16cd30

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4651135

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

entry.title: docs: Mention that most linux infra is on jammy now
entry.content:
Currently, the vast majority of chromium builds run on jammy. And

after https://crrev.com/c/4652993, any new builder will automatically

be running on jammy.



So jammy is now the official default for infra jobs. This updates

the docs to mention that, and clarifies them a little since the

statement about "most development" might apply to more than just CI

builds, and we can't be as confident about the OS breakdown outside

of our infra.

entry.title: viz: media: Mark MediaFoundataion for Clear quads as required for overlay
entry.content:
This CL will cause MF Clear videos, which appear as texture stream quads

on Windows, to have an overlay hint of "required". This causes

DirectRenderer to draw a fallback solid color quad when we fail to

promote it to overlay instead of trying to draw it directly.



This also reverts crrev.com/c/4568516 , as it's no longer needed.



I've also changed the overlay fallback color to be a different color in

debug builds, to help us quickly identify when we've hit this case,

since it should never happen.



Bug: 1448978

be using SiteDB are actually not accessing it. This restores some

histograms that were used to validate the initial SiteDB implementation

macros and StrCat instead of printf.

entry.title: [Metadata][Android] Use server side stretching when available
entry.content:
Currently when the card arts are fetched from SCS, they maintain the

aspect ratio. Since the aspect ratio required by the clients to does not

always match the original aspect ratio, clients resize the images.



In future, SCS will support stretching, so the clients need not resize

the images.



This feature is behind the AutofillEnableCardArtServerSideStretching

flag.

entry.title: Reland: "Add metrics to confirm traffic difference between CSBRR and hit report"
entry.content:
This is a reland of https://crrev.com/c/4639923. It was reverted in

https://crrev.com/c/4648251.



MSAN tests failed because members in HitReport are not initialized

in one unit test.



The diff is between Patchset 1 and the latest Patchset.



Original change's description:

> Add metrics to confirm traffic difference between CSBRR and hit report

>

> The metrics added last week (https://crrev.com/c/4611266) show some

> evidence on the traffic difference between ClientSafeBrowsingReport

> and hit report:

> * For mainframe warnings, around 20% of reports are not sent because

> there is already a report being collected.

> * For subresource warnings, 90% of reports are not sent because

> there is already a report being collected.

> Now we have a good explanation for subresource warnings, but there is

> still a gap for mainframe warnings. Add more metrics to investigate

> further.

>

> Histograms added:

> 1 interstitial.CloseReason

> This is helpful to understand the proportion of reports skipped because

> users close the entire tab.

>

> 2 SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.HasThreatDetailsForTab.SecurityInterstitial

> This is a breakdown of the original histogram because I realize the

> result is diluted by other types of reports (mainly ads sample).

>

> 3 SafeBrowsing.ClientSafeBrowsingReport.HasThreatDetailsInContainer.SecurityInterstitial

> This is to double check that as long as the collector is found, the

> threat detail job is not null. In theory, it should always be not null.

>

> 4 SafeBrowsing.HitReport.IsSubresource

> This is to track the total volume of hit reports from the client-side

> and the break down between mainframe and subresource reports.

>

> Bug: 1315455

> Change-Id: I83b235975d32b86130d5bec58d5b1ff801d19f81

> Reviewed-by: Chris Thompson

entry.title: Reland Flags UI: Remove jstemplate.
entry.content:
This CL guards code which should not be executed on iOS.



It also fixes another regression identified in the original CL, which

broke the "reset all" functionality.



jstemplate is deprecated and no longer used. This CL removes

its usage in chrome://flags, which also makes the page less

wasteful while rendering content.



The template rendering strategy attached all available experiments into

the DOM twice, one in a section for non-default experiments and one in a

section for default experiments. It then toggled the visibility of each

element depending on whether it was default or non-default.



This approach instead only attaches each experiment to its respective

section depending on its status as default. Therefore, no extra elements

need to be attached and toggled to 'hidden'.



This CL brings the time it takes to render experiments down from

1.5s to 1.25s on Linux.



Bug: 1376313, 525224

Change-Id: Iade2479a2b7333aeb051baf2d9ebca70a8199fbe

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4642668

entry.title: [SuperSize] Add support for multiple DEX in APK files.
entry.content:
Previously SuperSize assumes that each APK file has "classes.dex" as

the one and only DEX file. This CL adds support for having multiple (or

no) DEX files in each APK. Details:

* Change _ParseMainDexfileInApk() to _ParseDexfilesInApk(). Instead of

returning (DEX filename, dex_parser.DexFile) or None if non-existent,

the function now yields the above pairs for each DEX file. Stable and

sound ordering is assumed.

* Update CreateDexSymbols():

* Iterate over _ParseDexfilesInApk() results and process. Currently

this only affects string symbols and metrics_by_file; methods and

other symbols use apkanalyzer output, which is assumed to account

for multiple DEX files already.

* This also relaxes the previous assumption that an APK file has

>= 1 DEX files.

* Size checks and section_ranges use total sizes.



Bug: 1459015

Change-Id: Ic7e8ce7a2db2b0b0496c6fde929fd7b6719927cb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4654930

Reviewed-by: Andrew Grieve

entry.title: [ntp][lms] Verify non-uploaded custom background image links
entry.content:
If a user has a non-uploaded custom background image set and the image cannot be reached by SimpleURLLoader, the user's background is changed.



This is how we handle each case:

No custom background: Don't verify link

Uploaded custom background: Don't verify link

Custom background w/o daily refresh enabled: Reset user to Classic Chrome

Custom background w/ daily refresh enabled: Fetch the next image in the collection and set that as the user's background



*Video demo in bug comments*



Change-Id: I134ded18f87a49c8823429840caef81f76fe249e

Bug: 1433301

entry.title: Use required Image Capture constraints to overconstrain
entry.content:
Advanced constraints sets passed to the MediaStreamTrack

applyConstraints method should either be applied or discarded

(SelectSettings algorithm[1] step 5.2). They should

never cause an OverconstrainedError to be thrown. This CL fixed Image

Capture tests to use required constraints (such as

videoTrack.applyConstraints({brightness: {exact: 3}})

) instead of advanced constrained (such as

videoTrack.applyConstraints({advanced: [{brightness: 3}]})

) to throw an OverconstrainedError.



[1]: https://w3c.github.io/mediacapture-main/#dfn-selectsettings



Previously Chrome did not support required Image Capture constraints and

does treat advanced Image Capture constraints in the first advanced

constraint set as if they were required. Therefore Image Capture test

were written using advanced constraints instead of using required

constraints. This CL fixes that.



Bug: 1408091

Change-Id: Ib23348c81ec73fd8f2594baabf3433cfefadcd06

entry.title: Do not use std:vector::swap() in WaylandSurface::set_opaque_region()
entry.content:
... instead, do what set_input_region() does right below.



The use of `swap` was added in [1], some years ago, but it seems like

an improper logic: it first does the swap, and later it uses the

swap-out value.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/3211558



BUG=1443413

R=fangzhoug@chromium.org
